properties.address: Thirst Youth Cafe, Hertfordshire CM23 3AZ

Our doors are always open to anyone aged 11- 18.
properties.title: Thirst Youth Café

properties.address: Audley Rd, Saffron Walden CB11 3HD, UK
properties.description: Winter initiative: WARM SPACES Fridays 10 am -12 noon (from 25 November): Our hall is open as a warm and welcoming spac​e, for anyone who wants to drop in for a free tea or coffee, use the free wi-fi or take part in some activities ...and keep warm. There is a similar scheme being offered by Churches Together on Mondays, in the Town Hall, 10.00am till 3.00pm
properties.title: Saffron Walden Baptist Church – Warm Spaces

properties.address: Hill St
properties.description: The Jubilee Hub Partnership - a joint venture of UCAN, Enterprise East and Saffron Walden Town Council - has started a new vibrant Community Hub at the old day centre at the Garden Rooms. It takes place every Thursday from 12pm to 3pm, offering a warm welcome where anyone attending is provided with a free light lunch, a warm and welcoming space and lots of chat. Lunch is served between 12pm and 2pm, with tea and biscuits until 3pm. They also have Meet Up Monday every Monday morning between 10am and 12pm, with tea, coffee and chat. Everyone is welcome.
properties.title: Saffron Walden Warm Space – Jubilee Hub

properties.address: Crafton Green House, 72 Chapel Hill
properties.description: The TouchPoint Community Cafe is open every Thursday from 11am to 5pm. It is a welcoming place to relax and catch up with friends. A selection of hot and cold drinks and snacks are served, with hot food served between 12:30pm and 2:30pm. Tea, coffee and squash are free, with cakes and snacks available to buy.
properties.title: Stansted Warm Space – TouchPoint Community Cafe

properties.address: Crafton Grn, Chapel Hill, Stansted Mountfitchet, Stansted CM24 8AQ, UK
properties.description: We are a community hub in Stansted Mountfitchet, Essex. We are based at Crafton Green, right next door to the Library and the Crafton Green car park. We have a welcoming community café every Thursday and Friday, and a community garden that is open every day. As a community hub, people can access help and support from our partner organisations, join clubs and interest groups, and share their skills with others if they would like. At the heart of our centre is the TouchPoint Stansted Café. Alongside this, we make full use of this wonderful community building by running regular activities including walking groups, financial advice clinics, digital skills support, free breakfast club,community support groups and employment advice – to name but a few! We are also lucky to have a wonderful community garden, which will be cared for entirely by volunteers. It’s a tranquil spot, perfect to relax and unwind in, and is open to all to enjoy. We also run six weekly community food shares at three different locations distributing surplus supermarket food for free. These are open to everyone in the community, please see our website or social media for the most up to date timetable. The TouchPoint Community Café is open every Thursday from 11am to 5pm, and every Friday from 10am to 12pm, and is a welcoming place to catch up with friends and relax. We serve a selection of hot and cold drinks and snacks, with hot food available on Thursdays between 12.30pm and 2.30pm. Tea, coffee and squash are FREE, and cakes and snacks are available to buy. We also have a ‘Pay it Forward’ donation box if you would like to make a contribution. The hot food menu changes every week, and booking is recommended, please email book@thetouchpoint.org or contact us to reserve your meal. We are a Warm Space.   TouchPoint Stansted Community Food Share: Wednesdays 2.30pm - 3.15 pm Lower Street, Stansted, CM24 8LN Please bring a bag – and please only take what you will be able to use in the coming few days: the items have a short shelf life and we would hate them to go to waste!   TouchPoint Teatime A free hot meal for children and their parents or carers – it’s for all pre-school and school-aged children and the food is child-friendly. We also offer some activities like crafting and boardgames. It runs from 3.00pm to 5.30pm on Thursdays. It helps us to plan if we have an idea of numbers beforehand – it’s not essential but if you could let us know on info@thetouchpoint.org or message us on 07572 114882 that would be great.
properties.title: Touch Point Stansted

properties.address: 16 Chapel Hill
properties.description: he Place on the Hill is open in the church foyer on Wednesdays 10 am – noon for adults only Imagine sinking into a comfy sofa or armchair, sipping a cup of Fairtrade ground coffee…. The Place on the Hill offers this and more …. a selection of teas, light refreshments, good company, a place to ‘chill out’ and escape the telephone, books to read and borrow. There is also a jigsaw ‘on the go’ which anyone can add pieces to. Come to foyer of the Free Church, every Wednesday 10 am – noon. All adults welcome. No need to bring your purse, everything is free of charge. Whether you are a mum or dad, carer, homemaker, unemployed, working, retired, lonely, just need a place to have a sit before walking up or down Chapel Hill - or none of these!! - then a warm welcome awaits you at The Place. For more details please contact the Free Church Team on theplace@stanstedfreechurch.org.uk We look forward to seeing you.   Fun Place on the Hill is our new free drop-in which is every Friday 9.15am-11.30am in the Free Church Hall. Although particularly suitable for children, we welcome adults of all ages to come and join in the fun! Story time is at 10.30 am. There will be free tea/coffee and biscuits for the adults, and squash and healthy snacks for the children. The hall is warm and comfortable, and offers plenty of space for children to play with toys and run around.
properties.title: The Place on the Hill (Stansted)

properties.address: Saffron Walden, UK
properties.description: Warm Welcome Hub Working in conjunction with Churches Together in Saffron Walden, the Town Council is pleased to offer a FREE Warm Welcome Hub. The FREE Warm Welcome opens on Monday 28th November and every Monday thereafter (until 19th December) between 10.00-15.00 in the Town Hall, Saffron Walden. Please enter via the back door, facing Starbucks. The Warm Welcome will then recommence in 2023 on Monday 9th January 2023, again from 10.00 – 15:00 every Monday. On offer will be tea, coffee, biscuits throughout the day, along with soup and a roll from 12.00–14.00. There will also be FREE Wi-Fi, games, cards and provision for phone charging. Everyone is welcome to attend and no booking is required. Please come along and join us, sit and have a chat, cuppa and a bowl of warm soup in a safe, warm space. We would be grateful if anyone has any board games or puzzles, they would be willing to donate for use at the Warm Welcome. Any games or puzzles should be full sets (i.e., no pieces missing) and donations can be dropped off to the Warm Hub during the opening hours on a Monday (back of the Town Hall between 10.00-15.00.)
properties.title: Saffron Walden Town Hall

properties.address: Abbey Ln, Saffron Walden CB10 1AG, UK
properties.description: The Oasis If you are feeling overwhelmed, worn out, cold or just want a friendly chat, help is at hand at The Salvation Army in Saffron Walden every Wednesday from 11.30am to 3pm. That’s because we have launched Oasis Drop-in at our hall on Abbey Lane and anyone who wants a few minutes away from the trials and tribulations of modern life is welcome to drop in.
properties.title: Oasis Drop in – Saffron Walden, Salvation Army

properties.address: High St, Saffron Walden CB10 1AA, UK
properties.description: Somewhere 2 Sing offers weekly, local based adult singing groups across Hertfordshire, Bedfordshire and now into Essex. The music is popular, the classes are informal and it doesn’t matter whether you’ve been in choirs before or are coming along as a complete beginner, as you’ll be welcomed with open arms. Groups can range from about thirty to eighty members in each choir, with members spanning all ages. Come for the great music, make new friends, you can perform with us, and it’s great for mental health and well-being too. We are always working towards new exciting projects, which might be a recording, a flash mob, a local community event or a large-scale production – in which all our groups combine for an epic concert. There’s never any obligation to perform but read some of our members’ testimonials and check out some of the videos on our media page, as once you’ve taken the plunge and sung with a few hundred people, you certainly get the bug and will most likely want to do it again and again.
properties.title: Somewhere to Sing

Salvation Army Saffron Walden Abbey Lane CB10 1AG When? 1st and 3rd Thursday every month Time? 10am - 11.30am
properties.title: Bereavement Café, Saffron Walden

properties.address: Pam's Place, Vicarage Mead, Thaxted, CM6 2RL
properties.description: Welcome to Pam's Place We are a Charitable Incorporated Organisation set up to benefit all the residents of Thaxted and the surrounding area. We provide a building which can be used by everyone for many different uses. Our flexible space and well equipped kitchen can be used for meetings, parties, small or large group gatherings, private and public events. The kitchen is available for a cup of tea or a fully catered banquet and anything in between. Contact us to discuss your ideas and needs.   Activities as Pam's Place:   Mondays 9.30am - BUMP TO BABY: Are you a new or expectant mum looking to connect with others on the same journey, build lifelong friendships, share joys & challenges, create a supportive network? Join us every   11am - 6pm COMMUNITY CAFE: Everyone welcome! Pop in every Monday for tea and meet friends old and new. There are no set fees all we ask is a small donation (pay what you can manage). We also accept vouchers, for more information on this contact 07365 376899.#   Tuesdays 10.00am - PILATES Pilates class, all levels welcome, all equipment provided - Booking LINK here. 11am - CHAIR-BASED EXERCISE - Suitable for everyone. 2 - 4.30pm - THREADS - Friendly, happy, chatty, group of people that knit, crochet, or sew. With a mix of knowledge and experience in all these crafts they are happy to help with all sorts of projects. You will be very welcome whether you are a beginner or experienced. The group gather weekly and share their love of creativity!   Wednesdays 12.30 - 2pm - LUNCH: Everyone welcome - two course meal with tea/coffee £10 per person. Bookings only, contact 07365 376899 to reserve your place. 7.30 - 9.30pm: LECTURE SOCIETY - See notice board for more information.   Thursdays ALZHEIMER / DEMENTIA LUNCH: Two course meal with tea/coffee, £10 per person. Bookings only, contact 07365 376899.   Fridays 10 - 1pm - DROP-IN CAFÉ - Cakes and company. 2 - 4pm - SEWING GROUP- Perfect if you are looking for a more peaceful place with the company of friendly and creative sewers who are happy to help if you need a little advice.       We also offer a fabulous space for private parties with our fully furnished kitchen. For more information on any of the above contact: Tel: 01371 830094 or Cassy Burns on 07365 376899
properties.title: Pam’s Place (Thaxted)

properties.address: 7 Church St
properties.description: Coffee Morning The Church House every Wednesday 10am-11am Fancy a coffee, chat and some company? We have a very friendly coffee morning every Wednesday for all ages where you are guaranteed a giggle and a friendly ear to listen or a quiet corner should you prefer. What ever you need we are here to help each other. Newport coffee morning has now been running for 30 years and is very popular with a lot of local residents. A small donation is requested to cover the cost of the refreshments. We would love to see you soon, in the meantime if you would like any further information or have any questions please email Cheryl at cheryljm@hotmail.co.uk
properties.title: Coffee Morning (Newport, Saffron Walden)

properties.address: Clavering
properties.description: Newport Essex Meet and Eat is located in the Church House building right next to St. Mary the virgin Church in Newport. We are open evey Wednesday and Friday. We have a dedicated team to welcome and look after you, we are a warm and friendly space open to anyone in the village to pop in for a hot lunch or just a cuppa and a chat. All free of charge, donations welcome.   Who can use this service? Open to all in the community.   How are services delivered? Face to Face : Wednesday 12.30-2pm Friday 12.30-2pm
properties.title: Newport Essex: Meet & Eat
